main event: On November 2, 1958, witnesses observed a strange, flat, circular object resembling a low star in Jefferson City, Missouri.
interesting points: The object predominantly appeared orange with intermittent flashing., It hovered at an estimated altitude of 3,000 to 4,000 feet., The sighting lasted for about 2 minutes before the object suddenly accelerated and disappeared., Two witnesses reported the sighting., The consensus among investigators leaned towards the object being a satellite or similar aerial phenomenon.
sighted object: a flat, circular object resembling a low star
witness description: Two witnesses driving on Highway 50, 5 miles west of Jefferson City.
